label: Description
value: Base decorated with horizontally placed bow, erased arrows and a wreath of roses. Above, at right, a dial with a rose and bee at top. Below, an inscription, "Linconsatnt vaincu." At left, Cupid standing on a hassock cuts the wings of a bee.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and yellow, red, watercolor, pen and black ink, graphite, on cream laid paper

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

label: Description
value: Base on cushion feet, upper portion with circular elements simulating spouting water in center and at each side. Above base are two mermaids, one blowing a horn, the other covering her ears. They are seated in water, flanked by tall sea grass. Above is a clock, topped by a circular fountain.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and yellow, red, green watercolor, black wash, graphite, on cream laid paper

Memorial Panel Depicting Painting and Music

label: Description
value: A tablet contains an imaginative picture frame in the central park. It is flanked by pilasters, in front of which the statues of "Painting" and "Music" stand. Below, in the center, is an escutcheon, showing a representation of "Cybele"; it is supported by "Saturnus" and "Death," Above the entablature is an escutcheon with Cupid, flanked by a boar and dogs, at left, and a putto upon a dolphin, and other animals, at right. Colored background, framing line.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and black ink, brush and brown wash and white gouache, black chalk

label: Provenance

Preparatory Study for the Sculpture of Queen Leszczynska as Juno

label: Description
value:
Vertical format. A woman is shown standing between two figures.  Her right hand covers something carried by the left one, possibly a jar.  The upper part of another figure is shown beside her left foot.
Verso: Two studies of boys' heads, and part of a third one.  One is shown in profile, turned toward left; the other is in opposite direction and shown in three-quarter profile.

value: red chalk on laid paper (verso: red chalk, pen and ink)

Project for the Decoration of an Oblong Panel

label: Description
value: Two rinceaux are connected by two snakes and a leaf.  The latter forms, together with a calix, the support of a round table top, upon which a bowl stands on three tall legs.  Smoke emerges from the bowl. Two cornucopias are placed in the ring connecting the legs. Stems in heart form spring from them. Above, two birds sit upon festoons.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and watercolor over graphite on white laid paper

label: Provenance
value: Sarah Cooper Hewitt and Eleanor Garnier Hewitt; 1931: Acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt
Project for the Decoration of an Oblong Panel

label: Description
value: Below is a calix from which two curved rinceaux spring.  They end laterally in blossoms from which candelabra rise. They end above the head of the half-figure of a child. From the flowers and the lower scrolls of the figure hang festoons toward the candelabra. Birds are upon the upper ones from which trophies hang with implements of Cupid. Butterflies are at the ends of threads held by the birds.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and watercolor, black chalk, and graphite on white laid paper

label: Provenance
value: Sarah Cooper Hewitt and Eleanor Garnier Hewitt; 1931: Acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt
Project for the Decoration of an Oblong Panel

label: Description
value: A lyre form is composed of two cornucopias from which below stems rise.  They are connected above by a vase. The vase contains flower stems and spikes around which is a wreath with blue flowers. From the upper spirals hangs a ribbon with two entwined wreaths. The poins of the cornucopias are fastened together and connected with a caduceus by a ribbon.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and watercolor, graphite on white laid paper

label: Provenance
value: Sarah Cooper Hewitt and Eleanor Garnier Hewitt; 1931: Acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt
Design for Monument for van der Cammen-Henriques in the Church of St. Gumarus, Lier

label: Description
value: A woman crouches at the foot of an obelisk, leaning upon a sphere and holding a snake biting its tail, together with a putto who supports and escutcheon. A censer is on top of the obelisk before which two putti cross palm boughs, holding wreaths in their outside hands.  Written on the column: pilaer van der Kerck (against the pillar); in the obelisk: Swerte / steen / en / Witte / letteren (dark stone and white letters).

value: Graphite, pen and brown ink, brush and gray wash on laid paper

Design for a Painting: The Entombment of Christ

label: Description
value: Nicodemus, Joseph of Arimathea, and the kneeling Mary Magdalene hold the corpse beside the sarcophagus, behind which the Virgin kneels and nother mourning woman stands. The group is obliquely dispersed. St. John stands in the right foreground. Rocky background at left, Golgatha in the right distance. Framing ink lines.
